I'm Fernando, a Mexican :mexico: statistician and data scientist passionate about social and political applications. Within Statistics and Data Science, I found the perfect field(s?) to combine both my numerical and social inclinations.`r htmltools::HTML("{{< marginnote >}}My favorite subjects in school were always math and history. Going into college, I ended up with a funny combination, studying both a quantitative and a qualitative degree: Actuarial Science and International Relations.{{< /marginnote >}}")` After all: 

> The best thing of being a statistician is that you get to play in everyones's backyard.
> *John Tukey*

I've found my work in consulting extremely rewarding. From pulic opinion polling to market research, applied Statistics make me learn something new everyday. Far from being the best artist, I enjoy doing data viz in all of my projects. It's always satisfying when you have a better take or insight by means of better plots. I've also had the opportunity to teach probability to undergraduates, which I loved, so I'm looking forward to keep helping others in this way. My bachelor's degrees dissertation was on multilevel binomial regressions on French electoral data, fitted through Hamiltonian Monte Carlo. At ITAM, I had the opportunity of being editor of *Laberintos e Infinitos*, one of the students' magazines.


On a lighter note, I'm an avid football fan,`r htmltools::HTML("{{< marginnote >}}I mean football in both <i>fútbol</i> :soccer: and, well, :football: football... Always rooting for my beloved Necaxa :zap: and the Miami Dolphins :dolphin:!{{< /marginnote >}}")` although I am a much better table tennis player. I like reading historic novels and poetry, as well as dancing, singing, and playing the guitar, although I should do it more. Always looking to practice my French and Italian!`r htmltools::HTML("{{< marginnote >}}Si alguien quiere practicar su español, a la orden :raised_hands:.{{< /marginnote >}}")` 

Starting this fall, I will be at the University of Warwick studying the MSc in Statistics. Please, do get in touch at `fazepher@gmail.com` or on social media. 

## Some of my favorite tools 


Most of my work is in R, within R Studio. When doing Bayesian statistics, my over the counter tool is Stan. I also enjoy building Shiny apps. Without all the people out there who created and maintain these tools, my work as a data scientist wouldn't be the same. So, a big thanks to them!`r htmltools::HTML("{{< marginnote >}}Click on the icons to visit their websites{{< /marginnote >}}")`
